channel.title: Uploading client
channel.description: Okay so I have my client ready to launch, but how do I hide the files in my client so i can upload it without people stealing my shit? When you download most clients they have limited amount of stuff you can actually see, how do i get mine like that? any help would be much appreciated

item.title: Uploading client
item.dc:creator: @whitefox125 whitefox125
item.description:
@whitefox125 wrote:

I’ve created my executable jar file, I’ve put it in the file with my cache, and created a run.bat for my executable jar file. I took all of these things and zipped them and uploaded them, when i download them on another computer, extract them, and run the run.bat, the java screen appears, but it’s blank. I checked to make sure my auto cache downloader was coded correctly and it is. It should be working, and it’s not. I have a problem, I’m trying to get help solving it, you don’t have to be a condescending ass. Either help me, if you know how to troubleshoot my issue, or please don’t post on my thread.

Read full topic

item.title: Uploading client
item.dc:creator: @tyb97 tyb97
item.description:
@tyb97 wrote:

whitefox125:

Actually I have edited all of my coding… I’ve found that pretty much any base source and client comes with an abundance of trash code and is poorly written. I know the ins and outs of java pretty well, let me be a little more specific in explaining my problem. I took my client, ran it through a .jar maker and it comes out with one executable file, I took that and zipped it and uploaded it to media fire, downloaded it on another computer, ran it and got a blank java screen. so i obviously messed up somewhere, I’m familiar with programming, I’m not familiar with web hosting, and no I really don’t want my hard work leeched, so I’d like to know how to effectively upload my client, without deleting too much and without leaving more than what’s necessary.

Of course you are.

http://docs.oracle.com/javase/tutorial/deployment/jar/build.html

Read full topic

item.title: Uploading client
item.dc:creator: @tyb97 tyb97
item.description:
@tyb97 wrote:

Delete all the java files, jar, and obfuscate. You of course could always go all CoonHunter on that shit and make your own launcher lol’

@Zyle: I think he means just making it so people can’t leech the code that he hasn’t edited at all

Read full topic

item.title: Uploading client
item.dc:creator: @zyle1992 Zymus
item.description:
@zyle1992 wrote:

whitefox125:

Okay so I have my client ready to launch, but how do I hide the files in my client so i can upload it without people stealing my shit? When you download most clients they have limited amount of stuff you can actually see, how do i get mine like that? any help would be much appreciated

Any basic computer user can find those hidden files. All you’d need to do is enable the “Show hidden files” option on the explorer. And it’s really only hidden on windows, because Mac and Linux users have a different filesystem, and can see all of the files with the same change.

Read full topic
